docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Government has decided to grow its own marijuana -- at a top-secret site.

headline.main: Government to Grow Marijuana for Tests; U.S. to Grow Its Own Marijuana To Help Scientists in Research

docs.abstract: Fed Govt to grow its own marijuana, at a top-secret site, for experimental purposes; Natl Inst of Mental Health awards 7 contracts to research labs to produce it and tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), believed to be most active ingredient in drug; Dr Yolles discusses project; says confiscated stocks are inadequate for research projects, that lack of a standardized product prevents studies on effects of long-term usage; recipients of contracts identified
docs.snippet: The Federal Government has decided to grow its own marijuana -- at a top-secret site.

docs.lead_paragraph: UNTIL three years ago, Henry Whiteford, a tall, energetic midtown New York marketing executive, orbited in and out of a succession of high-priced private sanitariums. His condition had been diagnosed by his doctor as a manic-depressive reaction.

headline.main: Lithium vs. Mental Illness; Lithium vs. mental illness

docs.snippet: UNTIL three years ago, Henry Whiteford, a tall, energetic midtown New York marketing executive, orbited in and out of a succession of high-priced private sanitariums. His condition had been diagnosed by his doctor as a manic-depressive reaction.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- Inside its nucleus every living cell has a compete set of instructions for life.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 -- Scientists have found promising anticancer activity in a chemical being tested in the treatment of virus infections.

headline.main: A CANGER CURBED IN TESTS ON MICE; Credit Given to a Chemical That Also Fights Viruses

docs.abstract: Natl Health Insts drs rept promising anticancer activity in interferon, chem being tested in treatment of virus infections; details
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 -- Scientists have found promising anticancer activity in a chemical being tested in the treatment of virus infections.
